text: Perioperative risk assessment Age 245 years with a history of coronary artery disease, stroke or transient ischaemic attack, congestive cardiac failure undergoing elective non-cardiac surgery; or >18 years undergoing vascular surgery Is NP testing available? NOEIEIELTS LVEIELIE NP abnormal. NP normal BNP >99 pg/mL or NT-proBNP >300 pg/mL pErre=e T troponin monitoring intervention Fig. 2. (NP = natriuretic peptide; BNP = B-type natriuretic peptide; NT-proBNP = N-terminal prohormone B-type natriuretic peptide).
